problems.text: A football stadium expands its seating yearly. In the first year, 5,000 seats are added, in the second year 5,500, the third year 6,000, and so on. How many seats are added in the 50th year?
A scientist releases gas in intervals that increase arithmetically. The first release is 20 ml, the second 28 ml, the third 36 ml, and so on. What is the total gas released in the first 25 releases?

An oil tank is drained daily in an arithmetic sequence. On the first day, 1,200 liters are removed, on the second 1,150 liters, the third 1,100 liters, and so on. How many liters are removed on the 40th day?
A farmer arranges crops in rows. The first row has 60 plants, the second has 64, the third has 68, and so on. How many plants are there in total in the first 50 rows?
In a research project, a robot moves forward in an arithmetic sequence of steps. The first step is 2 meters, the second 4 meters, the third 6 meters, and so on. How long is the robot’s 120th step?
An event organizer sets up chairs in rows. The first row has 100 seats, the second row has 97, the third row has 94, and so on. How many seats are there in total in the first 30 rows?
